title: Vestas Wind Systems Weekly News Summary
body:
**Analyst Ratings:**

- *December 12, 2025:* Kepler Capital Markets upgraded Vestas Wind Systems AS (OTCMKTS:VWDRY) from a "strong sell" to a "strong-buy" rating. ([defenseworld.net](https://www.defenseworld.net/2025/12/12/kepler-capital-markets-upgrades-vestas-wind-systems-as-otcmktsvwdry-to-strong-buy.html?utm_source=openai))

- *December 6, 2025:* Vestas received a consensus recommendation of "Reduce" from six analysts, with two "sell," three "hold," and one "buy" ratings. ([defenseworld.net](https://www.defenseworld.net/2025/12/06/vestas-wind-systems-as-otcmktsvwdry-receives-consensus-recommendation-of-reduce-from-analysts.html?utm_source=openai))

**Financial Performance:**

- *November 5, 2025:* Vestas reported a GAAP EPS of €0.30, exceeding expectations by €0.08. Revenue increased by 3.1% year-over-year to €5.34 billion, though it missed projections by €70 million. ([gurufocus.com](https://www.gurufocus.com/news/3185236/vestas-wind-vwdry-reports-mixed-q3-results-with-eps-beat?utm_source=openai))

**Operational Developments:**

- *October 20, 2025:* Vestas suspended plans for a major factory in Szczecin, Poland, due to rising material costs and weak demand forecasts for offshore wind in Europe. ([gurufocus.com](https://www.gurufocus.com/news/3149938/vestas-vwdry-halts-polish-factory-plans-amid-rising-costs-and-low-demand?utm_source=openai))

**Market Outlook:**

- *December 9, 2025:* JPMorgan reiterated its Overweight rating and DKK164.00 price target on Vestas, citing robust prospects for the company's onshore wind business despite recent concerns over U.S. offshore wind projects. ([investing.com](https://www.investing.com/news/analyst-ratings/jpmorgan-reiterates-overweight-rating-on-vestas-stock-amid-strong-onshore-wind-outlook-93CH-4236495?utm_source=openai))

key_points.text: Kepler Capital Markets upgraded Vestas to a "strong-buy" rating on December 12, 2025.
Vestas reported a GAAP EPS of €0.30 on November 5, 2025, surpassing expectations by €0.08.
Vestas suspended plans for a Polish factory on October 20, 2025, due to rising costs and low demand.
